entry.title: Moonwalking With Einstein
entry.summary: Notes on Moonwalking With Einstein by Joshua Foer
entry.content:
A memory is a pattern of connections between your neurons.

Memory Palace or Method of Loci

Convert something unmemorable into a series of engrossing visual images and mentally arrange them within an imagined space, and suddenly those forgettable items become unforgettable.

Use vivid images that stand out for words and objects.

Major System

A simpler way to remember numbers. Wiki

PAO (person, action, object)

Faster but more difficult to master. This can be used for numbers and a deck of cards. Wiki

Every two-digit number from 00 to 99 is represented by a single image of a person performing an action on an object. Any six-digit number, like say 34-13-79, can then be turned into a single image by combining the person from the first number with the action from the second and the object from the third. Remember unique images. Like Michael jordan dunking over someone with a basketball and breaking the glass.

Getting over a learning plateau

If you hit a point of autopilot attempting to get better at something, force yourself to go 10-20% faster. Note the errors and fix them to get over the hump.

Reference: Rhetorica ad Herenium

entry.title: Show Your Work
entry.summary: Notes from Show Your Work by Austin Kleon
entry.content:
"Give what you have to someone, it may be better than you dare to think." Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Always be an amateur

  • Don’t be content with mastery, always be a student
  • Find your voice
  • Learn to take a punch and accept criticism
  • Shut up and listen.
  • Be a connector
  • Whatever excites you, go do it

Share something small every day

  • Share the work and the process
  • Tell good stories
  • Teach what you know
  • Share your trade secrets
  • Contributing something is better than contributing nothing
  • Ask, “So what?” before sharing
  • Don’t overshare

Become a documentation of what you do

  • Start a journal
  • Blog
  • Keep your notes

Credit is always due so give attribution

  • What is it?
  • Who made it?
  • When?
  • Why should we care?
  • How you found it?
  • Where we can find more things like it?

The stories you tell about the work you do have a huge effect on how people feel and what they understand about your work. This affects how they value it.

"To fake a photograph all you have to do is change the caption." Errol Morris

entry.title: Learn To Write
entry.content:
DISSECT AND RECONSTRUCT

  • Take good writing and jot short notes for each sentence.
  • Put the notes aside and come back in a few days.
  • Try to “rewrite” the piece using only the notes (and in your own words).
  • Compare with the original and correct your faults.

CONVERT TO POETRY (AND BACK AGAIN)

  • Take a story and convert it to poetry
  • Wait a few days
  • Convert your poem back to a story

UNDERSTAND STRUCTURE

  • Take your notes from EXERCISE #1 and jumble them up
  • Wait a few weeks
  • Reassemble the sentences as best as you can
  • Get feedback by comparing to the original

THE SECRET SAUCE

  • Obsession / hard work
